fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Trade, Culture, International co-operation and development, Customs, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Youth, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, External Relations, Food Safety, Transport, Climate Action, Communication
inter_groups:
Biodiversity, Country Side, Hunting and Recreational fisheries 
 
European tourism development, cultural heritage, Way of St. James and other European cultural routes
eu_initiatives:
1.    Environmental Impact 
Natura 2000 législations notably. 
2.    Reduced VAT/ fiscal situation in Member States  
Joint paper of EHHA, ELO and Europa Nostra answered the EC Consultation 
3.    Energy issues 
The European Historic Houses was involved with the lobby on the new Energy Efficiency Directive. Still very interested about the good and bad practices. 
4.    Illicit trafficking of cultural goods  (UNICRI –  ADSI specific point) 
The question of illicit trafficking of cultural goods is still pending as we plan to follow the question at the level of the DG Culture
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership: The European Historic Houses Association is a partner of the European Landowners' Organization (ELO), Europa Nostra, the Federation of European and International Associations established in Belgium (FAIB) and the Friends of the Countryside (FCS).
relevant_communication: Conférences, Newsletters and Annual Activity reports
